AccessConfig.name: AccessConfig
AccessConfig.description: A Compute Engine network accessConfig. Identical to the accessConfig on corresponding Compute Engine resource.

natIp.name: natIp
natIp.description: An external IP address associated with this instance.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of this access configuration file. Currently only ONE_TO_ONE_NAT is supported.

Action.name: Action
Action.description: An action that gets executed during initialization of the replicas.

timeoutMilliSeconds.name: timeoutMilliSeconds
timeoutMilliSeconds.description: If an action's commands on a particular replica do not finish in the specified timeoutMilliSeconds, the replica is considered to be in a FAILING state. No efforts are made to stop any processes that were spawned or created as the result of running the action's commands. The default is the max allowed value, 1 hour (i.e. 3600000 milliseconds).

envVariables.name: envVariables
envVariables.description: A list of environment variables to use for the commands in this action.

commands.name: commands
commands.description: A list of commands to run, one per line. If any command fails, the whole action is considered a failure and no further actions are run. This also marks the virtual machine or replica as a failure.

DiskAttachment.name: DiskAttachment
DiskAttachment.description: Specifies how to attach a disk to a Replica.

index.name: index
index.description: A zero-based index to assign to this disk, where 0 is reserved for the boot disk. If not specified, this is assigned by the server.

deviceName.name: deviceName
deviceName.description: The device name of this disk.

EnvVariable.name: EnvVariable
EnvVariable.description: An environment variable to set for an action.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the environment variable.

ExistingDisk.name: ExistingDisk
ExistingDisk.description: A pre-existing persistent disk that will be attached to every Replica in the Pool in READ_ONLY mode.

source.name: source
source.description: The name of the Persistent Disk resource. The Persistent Disk resource must be in the same zone as the Pool.

path.name: path
path.description: The localhost request path to send this health check, in the format /path/to/use. For example, /healthcheck.

port.name: port
port.description: The TCP port for the health check requests.

checkIntervalSec.name: checkIntervalSec
checkIntervalSec.description: How often (in seconds) to make HTTP requests for this healthcheck. The default value is 5 seconds.

host.name: host
host.description: The value of the host header in the HTTP health check request. If left empty (default value), the localhost IP 127.0.0.1 will be used.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of this health check.

description.name: description
description.description: The description for this health check.

unhealthyThreshold.name: unhealthyThreshold
unhealthyThreshold.description: The number of consecutive health check requests that need to fail in order to consider the replica unhealthy. The default value is 2.

healthyThreshold.name: healthyThreshold
healthyThreshold.description: The number of consecutive health check requests that need to succeed before the replica is considered healthy again. The default value is 2.

timeoutSec.name: timeoutSec
timeoutSec.description: How long (in seconds) to wait before a timeout failure for this healthcheck. The default value is 5 seconds.

Label.name: Label
Label.description: A label to apply to this replica pool.

Metadata.name: Metadata
Metadata.description: A Compute Engine metadata entry. Identical to the metadata on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

fingerPrint.name: fingerPrint
fingerPrint.description: The fingerprint of the metadata. Required for updating the metadata entries for this instance.

MetadataItem.name: MetadataItem
MetadataItem.description: A Compute Engine metadata item, defined as a key:value pair. Identical to the metadata on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

NetworkInterface.name: NetworkInterface
NetworkInterface.description: A Compute Engine NetworkInterface resource. Identical to the NetworkInterface on the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

networkIp.name: networkIp
networkIp.description: An optional IPV4 internal network address to assign to the instance for this network interface.

accessConfigs.name: accessConfigs
accessConfigs.description: An array of configurations for this interface. This specifies how this interface is configured to interact with other network services.

network.name: network
network.description: Name the Network resource to which this interface applies.

NewDisk.name: NewDisk
NewDisk.description: A Persistent Disk resource that will be created and attached to each Replica in the Pool. Each Replica will have a unique persistent disk that is created and attached to that Replica in READ_WRITE mode.

autoDelete.name: autoDelete
autoDelete.description: If true, then this disk will be deleted when the instance is deleted. The default value is true.

boot.name: boot
boot.description: If true, indicates that this is the root persistent disk.

NewDiskInitializeParams.name: NewDiskInitializeParams
NewDiskInitializeParams.description: Initialization parameters for creating a new disk.

diskType.name: diskType
diskType.description: Name of the disk type resource describing which disk type to use to create the disk. For example 'pd-ssd' or 'pd-standard'. Default is 'pd-standard'

sourceImage.name: sourceImage
sourceImage.description:
The name or fully-qualified URL of a source image to use to create this disk. If you provide a name of the source image, Replica Pool will look for an image with that name in your project. If you are specifying an image provided by Compute Engine, you will need to provide the full URL with the correct project, such as:
http://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/debian-cloud/ global/images/debian-wheezy-7-vYYYYMMDD

diskSizeGb.name: diskSizeGb
diskSizeGb.description: The size of the created disk in gigabytes.

autoRestart.name: autoRestart
autoRestart.description: Whether replicas in this pool should be restarted if they experience a failure. The default value is true.

initialNumReplicas.name: initialNumReplicas
initialNumReplicas.description: The initial number of replicas this pool should have. You must provide a value greater than or equal to 0.

description.name: description
description.description: An optional description of the replica pool.

baseInstanceName.name: baseInstanceName
baseInstanceName.description:
The base instance name to use for the replicas in this pool. This must match the regex [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?. If specified, the instances in this replica pool will be named in the format <base-instance-name>-<ID>. The <ID> postfix will be a four character alphanumeric identifier generated by the service.

If this is not specified by the user, a random base instance name is generated by the service.

targetPools.name: targetPools
targetPools.description: A list of target pools to update with the replicas that are managed by this pool. If specified, the replicas in this replica pool will be added to the specified target pools for load balancing purposes. The replica pool must live in the same region as the specified target pools. These values must be the target pool resource names, and not fully qualified URLs.

labels.name: labels
labels.description: A list of labels to attach to this replica pool and all created virtual machines in this replica pool.

selfLink.name: selfLink
selfLink.description: [Output Only] A self-link to the replica pool.

currentNumReplicas.name: currentNumReplicas
currentNumReplicas.description: [Output Only] The current number of replicas in the pool.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the replica pool. Must follow the regex [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? and be 1-28 characters long.

resourceViews.name: resourceViews
resourceViews.description: The list of resource views that should be updated with all the replicas that are managed by this pool.

abandonInstances.name: abandonInstances
abandonInstances.description: If there are instances you would like to keep, you can specify them here. These instances won't be deleted, but the associated replica objects will be removed.

Replica.name: Replica
Replica.description: An individual Replica within a Pool. Replicas are automatically created by the replica pool, using the template provided by the user. You cannot directly create replicas.

name.name: name
name.description: [Output Only] The name of the Replica object.

selfLink.name: selfLink
selfLink.description: [Output Only] The self-link of the Replica.

ReplicaStatus.name: ReplicaStatus
ReplicaStatus.description: The current status of a Replica.

details.name: details
details.description: [Output Only] Human-readable details about the current state of the replica

templateVersion.name: templateVersion
templateVersion.description: [Output Only] The template used to build the replica.

state.name: state
state.description: [Output Only] The state of the Replica.

vmLink.name: vmLink
vmLink.description: [Output Only] Link to the virtual machine that this Replica represents.

vmStartTime.name: vmStartTime
vmStartTime.description: [Output Only] The time that this Replica got to the RUNNING state, in RFC 3339 format. If the start time is unknown, UNKNOWN is returned.

abandonInstance.name: abandonInstance
abandonInstance.description: Whether the instance resource represented by this replica should be deleted or abandoned. If abandoned, the replica will be deleted but the virtual machine instance will remain. By default, this is set to false and the instance will be deleted along with the replica.

ServiceAccount.name: ServiceAccount
ServiceAccount.description: A Compute Engine service account, identical to the Compute Engine resource.

scopes.name: scopes
scopes.description: The list of OAuth2 scopes to obtain for the service account, for example: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control

email.name: email
email.description: The service account email address, for example: 123845678986@project.gserviceaccount.com

Tag.name: Tag
Tag.description: A Compute Engine Instance tag, identical to the tags on the corresponding Compute Engine Instance resource.

fingerPrint.name: fingerPrint
fingerPrint.description: The fingerprint of the tag. Required for updating the list of tags.

Template.name: Template
Template.description: The template used for creating replicas in the pool.

healthChecks.name: healthChecks
healthChecks.description: A list of HTTP Health Checks to configure for this replica pool and all virtual machines in this replica pool.

version.name: version
version.description: A free-form string describing the version of this template. You can provide any versioning string you would like. For example, version1 or template-v1.

VmParams.name: VmParams
VmParams.description: Parameters for creating a Compute Engine Instance resource. Most fields are identical to the corresponding Compute Engine resource.

canIpForward.name: canIpForward
canIpForward.description: Enables IP Forwarding, which allows this instance to receive packets destined for a different IP address, and send packets with a different source IP. See IP Forwarding for more information.

networkInterfaces.name: networkInterfaces
networkInterfaces.description: A list of network interfaces for the instance. Currently only one interface is supported by Google Compute Engine, ONE_TO_ONE_NAT.

serviceAccounts.name: serviceAccounts
serviceAccounts.description: A list of Service Accounts to enable for this instance.

disksToAttach.name: disksToAttach
disksToAttach.description: A list of existing Persistent Disk resources to attach to each replica in the pool. Each disk will be attached in read-only mode to every replica.

disksToCreate.name: disksToCreate
disksToCreate.description: A list of Disk resources to create and attach to each Replica in the Pool. Currently, you can only define one disk and it must be a root persistent disk. Note that Replica Pool will create a root persistent disk for each replica.

description.name: description
description.description: An optional textual description of the instance.

machineType.name: machineType
machineType.description: The machine type for this instance. The resource name (e.g. n1-standard-1).

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

structuredValue: View and manage your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information
View your Google Cloud Platform management resources and deployment status information
View your data across Google Cloud Platform services
View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services
commons.OathScopeDescriptions.name: commons.OathScopeDescriptions

oath2.name: oath2
oath2.description: Google Oath2.0 authorization. Detailed documentation can be found at https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OAuth2

projectName.name: projectName
projectName.description: The project ID for this request.

zone.name: zone
zone.description: The zone where the replica lives.

maxResults.name: maxResults
maxResults.description: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

pageToken.name: pageToken
pageToken.description: Set this to the nextPageToken value returned by a previous list request to obtain the next page of results from the previous list request.

methods.description: Gets information about a single replica pool.

poolName.name: poolName
poolName.description: The replica pool name for this request.

maxResults.name: maxResults
maxResults.description: Maximum count of results to be returned. Acceptable values are 0 to 100, inclusive. (Default: 50)

pageToken.name: pageToken
pageToken.description: Set this to the nextPageToken value returned by a previous list request to obtain the next page of results from the previous list request.

methods.description: Lists all replicas in a pool.
Gets information about a specific replica.
Deletes a replica from the pool.

replicaName.name: replicaName
replicaName.description: The name of the replica for this request.

methods.description: Restarts a replica in a pool.

numReplicas.name: numReplicas
numReplicas.description: The desired number of replicas to resize to. If this number is larger than the existing number of replicas, new replicas will be added. If the number is smaller, then existing replicas will be deleted.

methods.description: Resize a pool. This is an asynchronous operation, and multiple overlapping resize requests can be made. Replica Pools will use the information from the last resize request.
Update the template used by the pool.
